Event Name: Heroic Dog Saves Farmer’s Wife After Well Fall
Cost Impact:
Late Tuesday morning, a local farm's peaceful routine took a frightening turn when Mrs. Judith Harlow, wife of farmer Tom Harlow, accidentally fell into an old well on the couple’s property. Trapped nearly 10 feet down, her calls for help went unanswered—until the family's loyal dog, Rusty, sprang into action.

Rusty, a 4-year-old border collie known for his intelligence and loyalty, darted out of the farm and ran over a mile to the town’s fire station. Firefighters initially didn’t understand the commotion, but as Rusty barked and tugged at their sleeves, his urgency became clear. Realizing something was wrong, the firefighters followed the dog back to the farm.

The crew quickly located the well and rescued Mrs. Harlow, who sustained minor injuries but was otherwise unharmed. “Rusty is our hero,” Mr. Harlow shared, grateful for the life-saving loyalty of their furry family member.
